Package protocol

Class FileTransferProtocol

  • java.lang.Object
    • protocol.FileTransferProtocol
  • public class FileTransferProtocol
extends java.lang.Object
    Protocol for NU-5 File Transfer (final assignment module 2). This is version: 2020-04-15

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static byte[] ACK
      Mostly from downloader to uploader (but may be used v.v.): packet received!
      static int DEFAULT_CLIENT_PORT
      Default port used by client (may be changed).
      static int DEFAULT_SERVER_PORT
      Default port used by server (note: clients need fixed port).
      static java.lang.String DELETE
      When send by client: request deletion of file on server.
      static java.lang.String DELIMITER
      Delimiter used to separate arguments sent over the network.
      static java.lang.String DISCOVER
      When send by client: Discover server in local network.
      static java.lang.String DOWNLOAD
      When send by client: request download of file from server.
      static char ERROR
      Signal to indicate unknown message.
      static java.lang.String FAILED
      When send by client: NOT USED (YET) When send by server: server has failed.
      static java.lang.String HASH
      When send by client: request hash of file on server.
      static int HEADER_BYTE_OFFSET_LAST  
      static int HEADER_BYTE_OFFSET_START
      Header field: byte offset.
      static int HEADER_HEADER_LENGTH_LAST  
      static int HEADER_HEADER_LENGTH_START
      Header field: header length.
      static int HEADER_ID_LAST  
      static int HEADER_ID_START
      Header field: id.
      static java.lang.String INIT_SESSION
      When send by client: initialise session with server.
      static java.lang.String LIST_FILES
      When send by client: request list of file on server.
      static int MAX_ID
      Maximal value of the ID field in the header (based on field size in bytes).
      static int MAX_PACKET_SIZE
      Maximal size of a Packet (data for the DatagramPacket), consisting of header and payload.
      static int MAX_PAYLOAD_LENGTH
      Maximal value of the payload in a Packet (based on max packetSize - headerSize).
      static byte[] PAUSE_DOWNLOAD
      Mostly from downloader to uploader (but may be used v.v.): pause transfer.
      static int PAYLOAD_START
      Index of first byte of the payload, starting after the header.
      static byte[] RESUME_DOWNLOAD
      Mostly from downloader to uploader (but may be used v.v.): resume transfer.
      static byte[] START_DOWNLOAD
      From downloader to uploader: start transmission of bytes (used when downloader has to contact uploader first, e.g. trough firewalls)
      static int TOTAL_HEADER_SIZE
      Actual value of total header size: set to last assigned header field, in bytes.
      static java.lang.String UPLOAD
      When send by client: request upload of file to server.

        Default port used by client (may be changed).

      • DEFAULT_SERVER_PORT

        public static final int DEFAULT_SERVER_PORT
        Default port used by server (note: clients need fixed port).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAX_PACKET_SIZE

        public static final int MAX_PACKET_SIZE
        Maximal size of a Packet (data for the DatagramPacket), consisting of header and payload. Note: as imposed by the underlying UDP/Ipv4 protocols, this xould be maximal 65507 bytes.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DELIMITER

        public static final java.lang.String DELIMITER
        Delimiter used to separate arguments sent over the network.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ERROR

        public static final char ERROR
        Signal to indicate unknown message. (from either side, indicates that message is not known/understood)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DISCOVER

        public static final java.lang.String DISCOVER
        When send by client: Discover server in local network. Arguments (separated by delimiter): String nameOfClient Bytes: - When send by server: Respond to client sending DISCOVER in local network. Arguments (separated by delimiter): String nameOfServer Bytes: -
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INIT_SESSION

        public static final java.lang.String INIT_SESSION
        When send by client: initialise session with server. Arguments (separated by delimiter): String nameOfClient Bytes: - When send by server: Respond to client sending INIT. Arguments (separated by delimiter): int serverPort, running clientHandler Bytes: -
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LIST_FILES

        public static final java.lang.String LIST_FILES
        When send by client: request list of file on server. Arguments (separated by delimiter): - Bytes: - When send by server: Respond to client sending LIST_FILES. Arguments (separated by delimiter): - Bytes: File[] fileArray with all files in server storage
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DOWNLOAD

        public static final java.lang.String DOWNLOAD
        When send by client: request download of file from server. Arguments (separated by delimiter): int portOfDownloader Bytes: File fileToDownload When send by server: Respond to client sending UPLOAD. Arguments (separated by delimiter): int portOfUploader; long totalFileSize (in bytes); int startID Bytes: File[] fileToDownload (to client)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • UPLOAD

        public static final java.lang.String UPLOAD
        When send by client: request upload of file to server. Arguments (separated by delimiter): int portOfUploader; long totalFileSize (in bytes); int startID Bytes: File[] fileToUpload When send by server: Respond to client sending DOWNLOAD. Arguments (separated by delimiter): int portOfDownloader Bytes: File fileToUpload (to server)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DELETE

        public static final java.lang.String DELETE
        When send by client: request deletion of file on server. Arguments (separated by delimiter): - Bytes: File[] fileToDelete When send by server: Respond to client confirming DELETE. Arguments (separated by delimiter): - Bytes: File fileToDelete (on server)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HASH

        public static final java.lang.String HASH
        When send by client: request hash of file on server. Arguments (separated by delimiter): String localHash Bytes: File[] fileToCheck When send by server: Respond to client sending HASH. Arguments (separated by delimiter): String remoteHash Bytes: File fileToCheck (on server)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FAILED

        public static final java.lang.String FAILED
        When send by client: NOT USED (YET) When send by server: server has failed. Arguments (separated by delimiter): String failureMessage Bytes: -
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • START_DOWNLOAD

        public static final byte[] START_DOWNLOAD
        From downloader to uploader: start transmission of bytes (used when downloader has to contact uploader first, e.g. trough firewalls)

      • ACK

        public static final byte[] ACK
        Mostly from downloader to uploader (but may be used v.v.): packet received!

      • PAUSE_DOWNLOAD

        public static final byte[] PAUSE_DOWNLOAD
        Mostly from downloader to uploader (but may be used v.v.): pause transfer.

      • RESUME_DOWNLOAD

        public static final byte[] RESUME_DOWNLOAD
        Mostly from downloader to uploader (but may be used v.v.): resume transfer.

      • HEADER_ID_START

        public static final int HEADER_ID_START
        Header field: id. Length: 4 bytes (the int2Byte always puts in block of 4 bytes) Representing: id of Packet NOTE: ID should be encoded with big-endian encoding NOTE: ID may not be larger than MAX_ID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HEADER_ID_LAST

        public static final int HEADER_ID_LAST
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HEADER_HEADER_LENGTH_START

        public static final int HEADER_HEADER_LENGTH_START
        Header field: header length. Length: 4 bytes (the int2Byte always puts in block of 4 bytes) Representing: lenght of header NOTE: header length should be encoded with big-endian encoding NOTE: value may not be larger than 4 bytes [= 2^(4*8)]
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HEADER_HEADER_LENGTH_LAST

        public static final int HEADER_HEADER_LENGTH_LAST
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HEADER_BYTE_OFFSET_START

        public static final int HEADER_BYTE_OFFSET_START
        Header field: byte offset. Length: 4 bytes (the int2Byte always puts in block of 4 bytes) Representing: offset of bytes in payload of Packet (after String payload) NOTE: byte offset should be encoded with big-endian encoding NOTE: value may not be larger than 4 bytes [= 2^(4*8)]
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HEADER_BYTE_OFFSET_LAST

        public static final int HEADER_BYTE_OFFSET_LAST
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TOTAL_HEADER_SIZE

        public static final int TOTAL_HEADER_SIZE
        Actual value of total header size: set to last assigned header field, in bytes. NOTE: plus one, because indices start at zero (and lengths at one) NOTE: this length may not be larger than 4 bytes [= 2^(4*8)]
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PAYLOAD_START

        public static final int PAYLOAD_START
        Index of first byte of the payload, starting after the header. (note: header size is length, so already plus one)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAX_ID

        public static final int MAX_ID
        Maximal value of the ID field in the header (based on field size in bytes).

      • MAX_PAYLOAD_LENGTH

        public static final int MAX_PAYLOAD_LENGTH
        Maximal value of the payload in a Packet (based on max packetSize - headerSize).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
